title: Create Water Well from Banana Tree
brief: Extract water from banana or plantain tree roots by cutting the trunk and creating a collection bowl.
steps: Step 1: Locate a banana or plantain tree in good condition.
Step 2: Cut down the tree, leaving approximately 30-centimeter stump above ground.
Step 3: Scoop out the center of the stump to create a bowl-shaped hollow.
Step 4: Allow water from the roots to fill the hollow naturally.
Step 5: Discard the first three fillings as they will be bitter tasting.
Step 6: Collect and drink subsequent fillings which will be palatable.
Step 7: Cover the stump between collections to keep insects out.
Step 8: Continue collecting for up to four days from the same stump.
warnings: First three water fillings will be bitter - do not drink these.
Cover the stump to prevent contamination by insects.
Water production will cease after approximately four days.
